io.confluent.ksql.services

Interface KafkaTopicClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FakeKafkaTopicClient, KafkaTopicClientImpl, StubKafkaTopicClient

    public interface KafkaTopicClient
    Note: all methods are synchronous, i.e. they wait for responses from Kafka before returning.

      • createTopic

        default void createTopic(java.lang.String topic,
                         int numPartitions,
                         short replicationFactor)
        Create a new topic with the specified name, numPartitions and replicationFactor.

        If the topic already exists the method checks that partition count matchesmatches numPartitions and that the replication factor is at least replicationFactor

        Parameters:
        topic - name of the topic to create
        replicationFactor - the rf of the topic.
        numPartitions - the partition count of the topic.

      • createTopic

        default void createTopic(java.lang.String topic,
                         int numPartitions,
                         short replicationFactor,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> configs)
        Create a new topic with the specified name, numPartitions and replicationFactor.

        If the topic already exists the method checks that partition count matchesmatches numPartitions and that the replication factor is at least replicationFactor

        Parameters:
        topic - name of the topic to create
        replicationFactor - the replication factor for the new topic, or to use the default replication of the cluster
        numPartitions - the partition count of the topic.
        configs - any additional topic configs to use

      • createTopic

        void createTopic(java.lang.String topic,
                 int numPartitions,
                 short replicationFactor,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> configs,
                 org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.CreateTopicsOptions createOptions)
        Create a new topic with the specified name, numPartitions and replicationFactor.

        If the topic already exists the method checks that partition count matchesmatches numPartitions and that the replication factor is at least replicationFactor

        Parameters:
        topic - name of the topic to create
        replicationFactor - the replication factor for the new topic, or TopicProperties.DEFAULT_REPLICAS to use the default replication of the cluster
        numPartitions - the partition count of the topic.
        configs - any additional topic configs to use
        createOptions - the options to use when creating the new topic

        boolean isTopicExists(java.lang.String topic)
        Parameters:
        topic - name of the topic
        Returns:
        whether the topic exists or not

      • describeTopics

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.TopicDescription> describeTopics(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> topicNames)
        Call to get a one or more topic's description.
        Parameters:
        topicNames - topicNames to describe
        Returns:
        map of topic name to description.
        Throws:
        KafkaTopicExistsException - if any of the topic do not exist.

      • describeTopic

        Parameters:
        topicName - topicName to describe
        Returns:
        the description if the topic
        Throws:
        KafkaTopicExistsException - if the topic does not exist.

      • getTopicConfig

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getTopicConfig(java.lang.String topicName)
        Call to get the config of a topic.
        Parameters:
        topicName - the name of the topic.
        Returns:
        map of topic config if the topic is known, Optional.empty() otherwise.

      • addTopicConfig

        boolean addTopicConfig(java.lang.String topicName,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> overrides)
        Call to write topic config overrides to ZK.

        This will add additional overrides, and not replace any existing, unless they have the same name.

        Note: each broker will pick up this change asynchronously.

        Parameters:
        topicName - the name of the topic.
        overrides - new config overrides to add.
        Returns:
        true if any of the overrides did not already exist

      • getTopicCleanupPolicy

        KafkaTopicClient.TopicCleanupPolicy getTopicCleanupPolicy(java.lang.String topicName)
        Call to get a topic's cleanup policy.
        Parameters:
        topicName - topicNames to retrieve cleanup policy for.
        Returns:
        the clean up policy of the topic.
